intro: Anechites revolutus, commonly known as the curledleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open areas such as meadows and disturbed sites. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Anechites revolutus is considered a perennial herb and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
